task: Test Results: Week 2 Session State Configuration test failure analysis and resolution
phase: Phase 1 Week 2 Days 1-2: Session State Configuration

test_results_analysis.primary_issue: PowerShell variable reference syntax errors preventing module loading

root_cause_analysis.error_type: Variable reference is not valid. ':' was not followed by a valid variable name character
root_cause_analysis.pattern_identified: Variables followed by colons in string interpolation
root_cause_analysis.powershell_behavior: Parser interprets $variable: as scope/drive reference like $env: or $global:
root_cause_analysis.existing_learning_match: Learning #128: PowerShell Variable Colon Parsing in Strings

solution_implemented.fix_pattern: Use curly brace notation to delimit variable names

documentation_updates.pattern_documented: Week 2 Session State Module Variable Reference Syntax Errors
documentation_updates.critical_learning: Always apply Learning #128 pattern consistently across all new module implementations

expected_outcomes.core_functionality: Session state configuration should be operational

validation_required.success_criteria: Module loads, 19 functions exported, New-RunspaceSessionState works

objectives_assessment.short_term: Week 2 Session State Configuration implementation fixed and ready for validation
objectives_assessment.long_term: Parallel processing foundation maintained with proper syntax patterns
objectives_assessment.solution_quality: Applied existing documented learning pattern for immediate resolution
